web_mapping.reasoning: Web Mercator (EPSG:3857) is the standard for web mapping tiles. Use WGS84 (EPSG:4326) for GeoJSON data exchange.
pros: Consistent with Google Maps, OpenStreetMap, etc.
warnings: Do not use Web Mercator for area or distance calculations

distance_calculation.reasoning: British National Grid provides excellent accuracy for distance calculations within Great Britain. UTM zones are alternative for cross-border work.
pros: Single projection for all of Great Britain
cons: Not valid for Northern Ireland (use ITM)

area_calculation.reasoning: British National Grid is suitable for area calculations in Great Britain. Use ITM for Northern Ireland.
pros: Good area preservation within Great Britain
Single projection for England, Scotland, Wales
cons: Increasing distortion at edges of coverage
warnings: For Northern Ireland, use Irish Transverse Mercator (EPSG:2157)

survey.reasoning: British National Grid is the official survey system for Great Britain. Use OSTN15 transformation for highest accuracy.

navigation.reasoning: WGS84 is the standard for GPS/GNSS navigation. ETRS89 is practically equivalent for UK navigation.
cons: Geographic coordinates require conversion for display

data_exchange.reasoning: ETRS89 is the European standard for data exchange. Required for INSPIRE compliance. WGS84 for international data.
cons: Requires transformation from legacy OSGB36 data

data_storage.reasoning: ETRS89 recommended for new UK data. BNG for compatibility with OS data. WGS84 for international use.
cons: May require transformation for legacy applications

visualization.reasoning: British National Grid provides familiar UK map appearance. Web Mercator for interactive web maps.
cons: Not suitable for maps extending beyond UK

Northern Ireland.note: Northern Ireland uses Irish Transverse Mercator, not British National Grid
